#summary Running the application on the simulator.

== Running the App on the Simulator ==
Now that we have developed our application, lets test it on the Sun SPOT simulator, `Solarium`.
Create three new sensors in the simulator (`Emulator` * > * `New Virtual Spot`).

http://spotshout.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/tutorial/solarium.png

In the middle sensor deploy the application name server. Right click and select `Deploy MIDlet bundle ...` and browse the `SensorNameServer` project folder and select the `build.xml` file.

Start the application on the name server Sensor, right click on the sensor and select `Run MIDlet` * > * `SensorNameServer`.

http://spotshout.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/tutorial/solarium-mid.png

In the right sensor deploy the server calculator. Right Click on the sensor and select `Deploy MIDlet bundle ...` and browse the `SensorCalculatorServer` project folder and select the `build.xml` file.

Start the application on the Server Calculator Sensor, right click on the sensor and select `Run MIDlet` * > * `SensorCalculatorServer`.

http://spotshout.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/tutorial/solarium-right.png

In the left sensor deploy the client calculator. Right Click on the sensor and select `Deploy MIDlet bundle ...` and browse the `SensorCalculatorClient` project folder and select the `build.xml` file.

Open the output windows of the left sensor. Right Click on the sensor and selec the `Display application output` * > * `in Internal Frame`. 

Start the application on the Client Calculator Sensor, right click on the sensor and select `Run MIDlet` * > * `SensorCalculatorClient`.

http://spotshout.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/tutorial/solarium-execution.png
